title: Part A(i,ii)
stimulusHtml:
(i)

1 point(s) earned: For ranking IA as the greatest

1 point(s) earned: For ranking IC as the second greatest and IB as the third greatest

(ii)

1 point(s) earned: For a correct statement justifying that IA is greatest. (For example: The total current flows through RA and gets divided between the other two resistors.)

1 point(s) earned: For a correct statement justifying that CI is second and BI is third.

(For example: RB and RC share the current in the parallel segment, and that current divides between RB and RC so that the smaller resistor RC carries the most current.)
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

(i)

1 point(s) earned: For ranking IA as the greatest

1 point(s) earned: For ranking IC as the second greatest and IB as the third greatest

(ii)

1 point(s) earned: For a correct statement justifying that IA is greatest. (For example: The total current flows through RA and gets divided between the other two resistors.)

1 point(s) earned: For a correct statement justifying that CI is second and BI is third.

(For example: RB and RC share the current in the parallel segment, and that current divides between RB and RC so that the smaller resistor RC carries the most current.)

1 point(s) earned: For ranking IA as the greatest

1 point(s) earned: For ranking IC as the second greatest and IB as the third greatest

(ii)

1 point(s) earned: For a correct statement justifying that IA is greatest. (For example: The total current flows through RA and gets divided between the other two resistors.)

1 point(s) earned: For a correct statement justifying that CI is second and BI is third.

(For example: RB and RC share the current in the parallel segment, and that current divides between RB and RC so that the smaller resistor RC carries the most current.)

The student earns four of the following points:

(i)

1 point(s) earned: For ranking IA as the greatest

1 point(s) earned: For ranking IC as the second greatest and IB as the third greatest

(ii)

1 point(s) earned: For a correct statement justifying that IA is greatest. (For example: The total current flows through RA and gets divided between the other two resistors.)

1 point(s) earned: For a correct statement justifying that CI is second and BI is third.

(For example: RB and RC share the current in the parallel segment, and that current divides between RB and RC so that the smaller resistor RC carries the most current.)

title: Part B(i,ii)
stimulusHtml:
(i)

1 point(s) earned: For the correct ranking VA, VB, VC = 1, 2, 2

(ii)

1 point(s) earned: For a correct justification that VA is the greatest. (For example, because no resistor is greater than RA, and RA has the full current through it. Or, because RA is greater than the equivalent parallel resistance of RB and RC.)

1 point(s) earned: For a correct justification that VB = VC. (For example, since the voltage across the parallel resistors RB and RC is the same.)
descriptions:

1 point(s) earned: For a correct justification that VB = VC. (For example, since the voltage across the parallel resistors RB and RC is the same.)

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Let RBC be the resistance of the parallel combination of RB and RC .

1 point(s) earned : For one correct form for determining RBC

1 R BC = 1 R B + 1 R C = 1 2R + 1 R = 1 400Ω + 1 200Ω = 3 400Ω R BC = 2R 3 = 400Ω 3 =133Ω MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaadaWcaa qaaiaaigdaaeaacaWGsbWaaSbaaSqaaiaadkeacaWGdbaabeaaaaGc cqGH9aqpdaWcaaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaWGsbWaaSbaaSqaaiaadkeaae qaaaaakiabgUcaRmaalaaabaGaaGymaaqaaiaadkfadaWgaaWcbaGa am4qaaqabaaaaOGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaaIXaaabaGaaGOmaiaadk faaaGaey4kaSYaaSaaaeaacaaIXaaabaGaamOuaaaacqGH9aqpdaWc aaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaI0aGaaGimaiaaicdacqqHPoWvaaGaey4kaS YaaSaaaeaacaaIXaaabaGaaGOmaiaaicdacaaIWaGaeuyQdCfaaiab g2da9maalaaabaGaaG4maaqaaiaaisdacaaIWaGaaGimaiabfM6axb aaaeaacaWGsbWaaSbaaSqaaiaadkeacaWGdbaabeaakiabg2da9maa laaabaGaaGOmaiaadkfaaeaacaaIZaaaaiabg2da9maalaaabaGaaG inaiaaicdacaaIWaGaeuyQdCfabaGaaG4maaaacqGH9aqpcaaIXaGa aG4maiaaiodacqqHPoWvaaaa@675C@

1 point(s) earned : For one correct form for determining the total resistance

R t o t = R A + R B C = 2 R + 2 R 3 = 400 Ω + 133 Ω

1 point(s) earned: For the correct numerical value

Rtot = 533 Ω

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned: For one correct form for the current IA, using Rtot from part (c)

IA = ε / Rtot = 12 V / 533 Ω = 0.0225 A

1 point(s) earned: For the correct value of VC

VC = ε - VA = ε - IA RA = 12 V - (0.0225 A)(400 Ω )= 3.0 V

IC = VC / RC = 3V / 200 Ω

1 point(s) earned: For the correct numerical value of IC

IC = 0.015 A

Alternate solution

Using RB = 2RC and VB = VC so that IBRB = ICRC

For the correct numerical value for Itot

For correctly relating Itot to IC

For the correct numerical value of IC

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
In the new circuit, I B = 0 at equilibrium, so the total current goes through each of the two resistors

I t o t = E R A + R C = E 2 R + R = E 3 R = 12 V 600 Ω = 0.02 A

1 point(s) earned : For the correct value of the voltage across the capacitor

V C = I tot R C = (0.02 A)(200 Ω) = 4.0 V

Q = CV C

Q = (2.0 x 10 -6 F)(4.0 V)

1 point(s) earned : For the correct numerical value of Q

Q = 8.0 x 10 -6 C
descriptions:
